history.text: Hello, how are you?  So looks like we are talking about The Social Network today.
hello, im good
ok
Did you know it got an average rating of 9/10
Thats high, it was an interesting movie
Yes i loved watching it, I saw it in theaters when it was released.   I think that Jesse Eisenberg did a great job staring a Mark Zuckerberg.
Yes, he played the role well.
Did you know that the movie was adapted from a book?
no, I did not.  Sounds like it would be a good one.  I heard that the real Mark was unhappy with the movie and said it didnt happen like that at all
Yes i heard the exact same thing.  But you know how movies are they usually change the way events happen to suit them better.
that's true
I cant believe all he got was 6 months of academic probation from crashing the servers at harvard!  I would say in todays terms that would probably put you in jail, let alone suspend you from school.
yes, maybe they saw the potential and decided go easy on him
yes maybe, I cant believe how successful his website was at first look.  Its amazing how horrible network traffic was back in 2003...
I think that the original name for facebook was funny.  Facemash!  What a crazy name
even facebook was a dumb name, but it worked!
Its funny that Facemash was only female pictures stolen from the Harvard servers.  I still cant believe Mark didnt goto jail for that...  I agree that facebook is a dumb name as well...
It was amazing that they were able to spread their website to other universities.  Yale especially.
Do you think that moving to Palo Alto was a good idea for the Facebook team?
yes, I cant believe his own friend turned on him
I think that living together and working together is not a good idea as they soon found out.
yes
do you think the twins were right to sue mark?
I still think it was very deceptive how Mark shut out the twins from his facebook project...  He really robbed them blindly.
but he paid for it, no one really knew how successful it would be
yes as there was never anything as successful as Facebook, and there never probably will be.
very true
I think that mark was in a stalking mood when he sent Albright a friend request on facebook...
yes, and when he created the "poke"
Yes i always thought that the poke was a stupid joke...
I think we are done here.  Hope you have a great day.
bye

uid2response.feedback: Interesting conversation.  thanks for allowing me to take park in your movie conversations.  Best of luck with your research!
